page.title: 03LEISURE (COMMENTS) I
page.content: Our area contains some pleasant countryside ideal for country walks and picnics.A fair proportion of the children take advantage of this.A lot of fishing goes on but,surprisingly,no horse riding.The grassy areas of the estate are used by the children for games of soccer and cricket,but informal games like tag (tiggy),tin can lurkey,skipping,ball juggling and hop skotch are played in the street. There are virtually no clubs or organised activities within our area other than those provided by the schools or churches.They include chess ,music,sport and youth clubs.To join clubs other than these the children have to travel further afield into Lancaster and Morecambe.Approximately 20 different clubs were available including self defence,fishing,dancing,
